author: Gus Monod
comment: I tried this app after FocusGTD that does the same kind of thing for a lower price. This app looks much better, but lacks basic functionality, and has terrible problems: IT DELETES ALL NOTES AND REPEATED TASKS!
title: Very pretty… not so useful

author: Anthony Le
comment: Update:  Also Sub Actions do not appear...  Update:  It's been 2 months without any updates....  Update:  There has been some updates, will change from at least it warns about repeating tasks...1 star to 2 star...please implement access to notes too. Update: looks like he abandoned this app
title: REPEATING TASKS GETS WIPED OUT

author: Johnny Hobbes
comment: Pros:  The developer Steve is very accessible and helped me out when I had some trouble setting it up.   No major syncing issues helping me stay OmniFocused when away from my computer.   Cons: Still has more features it needs to add. Missing the ability to set custom due dates and custom repeating options. Also I would really love there to be a calendar view option.    10/ 24/ 2016 UPDATED:   Now Steve won't respond to emails. It completely won't work and he won't get back to me so it's wasted money. DON'T BUY.

author: Zach McDowell
comment: I've been a dedicated Omnifocus user for years now, and recently jumped the iOS ship. Steven got back to me very quickly about my questions and suggestions - which is quite impressive! As a new application, it needs some work (which he is obviously doing!) but is still quite usable - I think it is fair to say that this is an investment in a good app that has the promise of being a great app. As long as we don't have to pay another $12.99 for the next version, it is money well spent! Update: This app kept promising but never came through. The developer promised to make all sorts of improvements and its still barely functional with basic things like repeating tasks. I'm so tired of this app I never use it anymore.

author: Alex Roman
comment: I think this is the best omnifocus client for android. However, it seems like it was never finished. The main feature I would like to see fixed is the ability to check off repeating tasks, which is strangly lacking :(
title: Great Client missing a couple things

author: Ben Farrell
comment: After login into my Omnisync account I get the synchronising screen which completes the process but when I click 'finish setup' it goes back to synchronising. I can't get passed this and even see my tasks.
title: Stuck in setup loop

author: Michael Acosta
comment: The app cost me $12+ or $14 and now since it's not under development no more it does not connect with omnisync. Do not buy.
title: Burglar!

author: Aviv Melamud
comment: It doesn't work. Every time it finished syncing I clicked finish and it started syncing again.

author: DC8 Mobility
comment: Its dead already. I can not accept to my app
title: Disappointed

author: Lourenco de Azevedo
comment: I instaled it but the new change on the database on omnifocus doesn't let this app to sync.  When will it be avaliable the compatibility with the new database?

author: Sophia Park
comment: Stuck in setup loop.

author: Francis Fryscak
comment: Excellent Android option for using software that otherwise exists only on Apple iOS

author: Tim Hargreaves
comment: Very limited features. No repeated tasks. Syncing rarely works and notifications don't pop up.
title: Not worth the money

comment: I can't see subtasks in the projects perspective?! What the hell?
title: Pretty good but...

author: Rob Williams
comment: Abandoned.
title: Seems good

author: Zach Mitchell
comment: I had a Note 4 on 4.4, and the app worked just fine. I just got a nexus 6 running 5.1, and now the app won't even open.
title: Always crashes on 5.1

author: Mukom Akong T.
comment: Lacking basic functions like ability to edit tasks. There's no access to notes and task groups don't work
title: Still Green

author: Annie Liu
comment: I used this once, and somehow I uninstalled it, I guess I was using another form of to-do list. Anyhow, I wanna move back to omnifocus with my android but I just can't install this app.
title: Can't install

author: Rado Sław
comment: Currently does not work.

reply.author: Quantus Software
reply.content: the first time syncing can take bit long indeed. nut follow up syncs are incremental and thus a lot shorter. It should also automatically resync every hour.

title: Stopped working. Waste of time.

author: Leonardo Wolff
comment: This is the only player in the house,  for that reason I give 3 stars.  The app itself need a lot of tweaking...so I would give 2..
title: Need a lot of work

author: Greg Pretlove
comment: ... plenty of room for improvement.
title: Good start ...

author: Beirne Konarski
comment: I've been using Omnifocus on and off for years, but since I switched to Android for my phone things were much less convenient, to the point that I started tracking my tasks on Toodledo instead of Omnifocus.  I really missed Omnifocus, though, so I tried Quantus Tasks.  The first version I tried wasn't working well enough so I switched back to Toodledo, but then they did a lot of work on Quantus Tasks that I went back to it and even paid for an upgrade to Omnifocus 2.  I use QA for two main things: seeing what tasks I have to do and entering simple tasks.  It does a great job at both of these and I haven't had any problems.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it does not handle repeating tasks very well, and I have to make sure I don't check them off  the will be closed without repeating.  Aside from that QA works well and the developer is actively adding features.  I'm glad to be back on Omnifocus, with the help of Quantus Tasks.
title: Much improved; it brought me back to Omnifocus

author: Laura Bacon
comment: Not being able to see sub-actions in action groups makes this practically useless for me.                                           PROS:  only omnifocus android app.                                                               CONS:  so much limited functionality.  You can't even edit action titles.  Really buggy too.  Would be worth $5, but at $13 it needs to deliver a lot more.
title: I get more irritated by this app every time I use it

author: Amit Kanabar
comment: In description it says app will be updated every 2 weeks, and so did developer on emails. Last update was 2 months ago, and app is lacking. I paid a lot for this, in the hope it'd be a fully functioning app, but its remained as beta for ages, without any update
title: No updates

author: Artem Gordinsky
comment: Lacks support for action notes, due/defer time (only date with default time currently) and nested project actions. Sync is still not particularly reliable. Background sync sometimes stops working or lags several days behind. Some actions seem to drop out of sync, being present in the app, but not in OF.
title: Not good enough as an OF supplement

author: Rob Kerwin
comment: While it is great to be able to use OmniFocus on my Android devices, there is alot of functionality missing and some obvious bugs.  If the developer could achieve his vision of making it as functional as the OEM version, it would get 5 stars.
title: Could be better

author: Nikolay Khokhlov
comment: I do not understand the wording here:  "Better notes/attachment support" kinda means notes/attachment support is already existent, which is not the case.  Anyway, looks like this is the best on Android. Please bring notes/attachment.
title: Better notes/attachment support ?

author: Dave W
comment: Still unable to view projects under some tasks. Data loss of notes when editing in quantus. How about an update dev?
title: No updates

author: Stacy Nimmo
comment: I had to transfer to Omni sync data base but after that its been working great!
title: Works great with Omni sync

author: Gus Eggert
comment: To me, the most important feature of an app like this is to be able to quickly capture ideas and todo items while I'm away from my computer.  This app does that perfectly and seamlessly.  It's not a fully featured client, but that's not what I need.  I use Box so I am grateful that this has WebDAV support too.  Good job and please keep developing this app!
title: Great start

author: Luca Sergio
comment: I just wanted to express my thanks for the recent update to add offline editing.  This is becoming a great addition to my Omnifocus work flow. As a developer you've been incredibly responsive and have rolled out a few nice updates. I appreciate your roadmap and your commitment to making this even more robust still.  Thank you.
title: A further update

author: Ernani Tadili
comment: This app lacks the basics of OMNIFOCUS.  Does not allow me to delete items. 3 stars only.
title: It's getting better

author: Franklin Fuentes
comment: I took the $12 plunge on the optimistic reviews and attractive interface. This app has worked less than 30% of the time. When I add something to my inbox it freezes the app. Currently my projects list is empty on my phone despite having dozens of projects on Omnifocus server. Steven at Quantas has yet to respond to any of my messages. This app is so buggy and hardly works for me at all on my Nexus 5. I wonder how it got all these positive reviews. I hardly post reviews on apps but this one is very poor.
title: Works less than 30% of the time, unresponsive support

author: Adrian Severynen
comment: The missing link! I love this software - never thought I'd be able to sync my OmniFocus to my Android.  The developer has been extremely responsive to any issues I've had, and has a roadmap of some pretty cool features.
title: Awesome application

author: Kenny Fraser
comment: Prompt support for a crashing issue I had, which resolved it.  Very useful app and good value in light of a lack of an official Android version.
title: Good support.

author: Raj Sekharan
comment: I've been needing a Android version of the exceptional Omnifocus for so long. This application is well designed and has adequate that you would need.   It has potential to be much more than it is right now. I recommend it. I hope the developer considers adding more features like calendar integration, location, file attachments, etc.
title: Good start

author: Beerinder Rodey
comment: Ability to add and manage tasks offline is a must have.
title: Great start

author: Adam Gibbins
comment: Holy crap, its come at last!

author: Nazeeh Shoura
comment: The app is still missing some essential features yet it hasn't been updated since last October!!
title: Abandoned
